title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 80-7.8 - Test procedure
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 80-7.8 - Test procedure

State Regulations
(a) Mount the specimen horizontally on the support frame with the sewn sides and
end held at a one-inch thickness by the U-shaped hold-down plate, spacers and
clamps. (b) Attach two #50 white
mercerized cotton threads to one edge of the frame at points 11/2 inches and
111/2 inches back from the open end, i.e., with 10 inches in between, and
stretch across the sample, attaching small weights to the overhanging ends of
the threads. Timing will begin and end as the respective threads burn through
and their weights drop. (c) With
the flame adjusted in accordance with subdivision (h) of section
80-7.6
of this Part and the frame
with mounted specimen in the test cabinet, position the burner so that the
center of the burner tip is 3/4 inch below the center of the edge of the
exposed end of the specimen. (d) Lower the door of the test cabinet. (e) Expose the sample to the flame for 30
seconds to force ignition. Note: The most reproducible results are produced when the fan
in the hood is turned off, or down if a variable speed fan is used, during the
30 second ignition period. During this time it is desirable that the burner
flame not flicker. Following the ignition period the fan should be turned back
up to exhaust fumes, yet not cause a draft in the test cabinet. (f) Begin timing when the first
weight drops and continue until the second weight drops or until the flaming
stops. (g) Calculate the burn rate
using the following formula: B = 60 × D/T
Note: B = Burn rate in inches per minute
D = Distance the flame travels in inches, and
T = Time in seconds for the flame to travel D
